0.descriptionId: A punch that causes slight damage to your opponent. You really need a weapon to be effective.

3.descriptionId: Inflicts Fire-type damage and steals Intelligence.

4.descriptionId: Reduces all close-combat damage suffered for 1 turn, and increases the target's MP if they suffer ranged damage.

5.descriptionId:
Reduces damage taken by allies and enemies for 1 turn.
The caster can not cause damage during the next turn.

7.descriptionId: Reduces damage taken in all elements.

8.descriptionId: Inflicts Earth damage and steals Strength.

9.descriptionId: Causes Water damage and steals Chance.

11.descriptionId: Teleports to the targeted cell and triggers the targeted glyphs.

13.descriptionId: Places a Glyph which inflicts Fire, Water and Earth damage to those around the targeted cell at the end of the turn.

16.descriptionId: Applies a shield that reduces the damage inflicted by the next attack.

19.descriptionId: Inflicts Water damage and steals range from the target.

20.descriptionId: Reduces all long-range damages received and increases the target's Power if they receive close-combat damage.

41.descriptionId:
Summons a Living Bag that suffers damage on behalf of its allies.
The Living Bag only protects allies within the spell's area of effect when it is cast.
The Living Bag dies after 4 turns.

42.descriptionId: Increases the target's Dodge for the current turn, and increases its Power considerably for the following turn.

44.descriptionId: Shovel Kiss does not require a line of sight and inflicts Fire damage.

46.descriptionId: Inflicts Fire damage. Damage is doubled on Summons.

47.descriptionId: Restores HP based on the target's maximum Vitality, but decreases the caster's ability to reduce MP for the following turn.

48.descriptionId: Inflicts Earth damage in a cross-shaped AoE.

49.descriptionId: Ghostly Shovel inflicts Fire damage and can reverse the effects of spells cast on the target.

51.descriptionId: This spell allows you to throw fake gold coins at an enemy from a long distance. It inflicts Water damage.

52.descriptionId: Greed makes everyone dangerously crazy and increases damage to all players, allies and enemies alike.

53.descriptionId: Inflicts Earth damage and lowers MP Parry at short range.

54.descriptionId: Reduces the AP of enemies in the area of effect.

56.descriptionId: Inflicts Water damage and removes MP.

57.descriptionId: This spell summons a shovel that repels enemies and reduces their resistance to MP loss.

58.descriptionId: Slaughtering Shovel causes a lot of Water damage to an enemy.

60.descriptionId: Summons a Living Chest which increases the loot won at the end of the fight and detects invisible objects and fighters. The lower the Living Chest's HP, the higher the damage it inflicts in its vicinity.

Boost the ally of the Scaraleaves
(1-Fire / 2-Water / 3-Earth / 4-Air / 5-Neutral)

363.descriptionId: Allows you to convert AP into MP.

364.descriptionId: Throws a magic Boomerang which causes damage of a random type.

366.descriptionId: Inflicts Air-type damage and reduces range.

367.descriptionId: This spell plants a wegenewative Cawwot in the soil.

368.descriptionId: That spell allows the caster to repel any players in the vicinity.

369.descriptionId: Lightning Strike inflicts fire damage - on ally and enemy alike - within its area of effect.

373.descriptionId: This spell allows you to summon a Chaferfu but he won't necessarily obey your orders.

390.descriptionId: This spell increases the damage you inflict with a staff.

391.descriptionId: This spell increases the damage you inflict with a sword.

392.descriptionId: This spell increases the damage you inflict with a bow.

393.descriptionId: This spell increases the damage you inflict with a hammer.

394.descriptionId: This spell increases the damage you inflict with a wand.

395.descriptionId: This spell increases the damage you inflict with a dagger.

396.descriptionId: This spell increases the damage you inflict with a shovel.

397.descriptionId: This spell increases the damage you inflict with an axe.

410.descriptionId: All dice rolls made on the target of the spell are maximised.

411.descriptionId: This spell will kill everyone... except you of course.

412.descriptionId: Steals Water health points and push back enemies. Heals allies and repels enemies.

413.descriptionId: Allows the caster to capture defeated creatures' souls at the end of a fight.

414.descriptionId: This spell enables you to tame a mount just long enough for you to capture it, and increase the experience won by your mount after a fight.

415.descriptionId: This spell provokes immediate heart failure. If the target is heartless, well then it provokes brain freeze. And if the target is a Iop, it provokes a more inexplicable kind of lifelessness.

416.descriptionId: All dice rolls by the target are minimised.

418.descriptionId: Repels allies or enemies by several cells, even if they are blocked by other enemies or allies.

420.descriptionId:
Revives the last allied character who died.
If the summoner dies, the revived character dies too.
Applies the Zombie and Unhealable states to the revived entity for the rest of the fight.

421.descriptionId: Increases allies' damage each time they suffer damage themselves.

423.descriptionId: Summons a barrel that attracts enemies. If carried: heals around the carrier.

424.descriptionId: Returns all players to their positions at the beginning of combat.

425.descriptionId: Prevents the use of all displacement spells and movement points. The spell's caster is affected the following turn.

426.descriptionId:
Summons a controllable Tree that can: 
• Push a target. 
• Shorten the length of bewitchments. 
• Heal in an area of effect (3 cells around itself). 

Heals all of the caster's dolls on the field. Disappears at the end of its turn. 
Can only by summoned by sacrificing a doll or a tree.

427.descriptionId: Increases Eniripsa's damage but prevents her from healing for 3 turns. The spell's effects cannot be unbewitched.

430.descriptionId: Summons a controllable robot that can push, attract or trigger bombs. The robot explodes at the end of its turn.

431.descriptionId: Increases the Sacrier's strength when he loses HP.

432.descriptionId: Inflicts Earth damage in an area of effect. Applies a Dodge penalty.

433.descriptionId: Increases the Chance of Sacriers when they lose HP.

434.descriptionId: Attracts a target toward the Sacrier.

435.descriptionId: Transfers part of the Sacrier's HP to his allies.

436.descriptionId: Steals HP and inflicts Air damage.

437.descriptionId: Increases the Agility of Sacriers when they lose HP.

438.descriptionId:
Switches places with an ally.
Cannot be cast on the same turn as Cooperation.

439.descriptionId: Steals Health Points through Water around the Sacrier.

440.descriptionId: Allows the caster to take damage received by targeted allies.

441.descriptionId: Gives back HP to the Sacriers when they lose HP.

442.descriptionId: This spell allows its caster to steal HP from an enemy by inflicting Fire damage.

443.descriptionId: Increases the Intelligence of Sacriers when they lose HP.

444.descriptionId: This spell allows a close-combat attack to be parried.

445.descriptionId:
This spell allows the caster to switch places with an enemy.
Cannot be cast on the same turn as Transposition.

446.descriptionId: Inflicts Neutral damage. The closer the Sacrier is to having half HP, the more damage they deal.

447.descriptionId: This spell allows the caster to increase his damage.

448.descriptionId: Summons a sword that steals HP in the Earth element.

449.descriptionId: This spell allows the caster to switch places with an ally or an enemy.

450.descriptionId: Steals life from a targeted ally.

453.descriptionId: Earth Armour prevents neutral and earth-type attacks.

459.descriptionId: The Healing Word lets you heal an ally.

460.descriptionId: This spell lifts any spells cast on an opponent.

461.descriptionId: This spell increases damage inflicted by the Perceptors and his allies.

462.descriptionId: This spell reduces the enemy's chances of scoring critical hits.

464.descriptionId: This spell enlists the help of the fearsome Crocobur when you attack.

481.descriptionId: This spell repels players around the caster.

482.descriptionId: This spell inflicts Earth damage and has a range of 2 squares.

490.descriptionId: This spell allows the Crocoburio to restore his Health Points.

515.descriptionId: This spell allows the Crocoburio to switch places with one of these creatures.

516.descriptionId: This spell allows the Crocoburio to absorb the health of an ally.

517.descriptionId: Spell of Radlu Minite the Drunken Dark Miner.

519.descriptionId: Attack of a Feca Monster for a Newbie quest.

521.descriptionId: Kitsounes are cunning creatures, and they want you to know it! Be careful! (Random bonuses on allies for two turns).

573.descriptionId: Launches a state that prevents players from using teleportation spells.

584.descriptionId: This spell lets Treechnids use other spells.

585.descriptionId: This is a Treechnid spell when they are under Sylvan Motivation.

586.descriptionId: This is a Dark Treechnid spell when it is under Sylvan Motivation.

4205.descriptionId:
At the end of the turn, gives the caster 1 additional Range for the next turn if there are no enemies adjacent to them.
If there are any enemies adjacent to them at the end of the turn, applies a 1-Range penalty to the caster and a 20-Lock bonus per enemy entity until the end of the next turn.
Reveals all adjacent enemy entities at the end of the turn.
